title: Aaron Ramsey a doubt for Wales' Euro 2020 qualifier against Croatia after suffering thigh problem
text:
Aaron Ramsey remains a doubt for Wales' Euro 2020 qualifier against Croatia on Sunday as he continues his recovery from a thigh injury.

The midfielder stayed in Cardiff for Wales' 1-1 draw in Slovakia on Thursday after picking up the injury in the warm-up prior to Juventus' 2-1 win over Inter on Sunday.

Ramsey's last played for Wales in a game with points on the line against Denmark on November 16, 2018.

Aaron Ramsey could miss Wales' clash with Croatia on Sunday after picking up a thigh injury

Ramsey was left out of Thursday's 1-1 draw with Slovakia to focus on getting fit for Croatia

Ramsey hasn't played a competitive game for Wales since November's clash with Denmark

Wales boss Ryan Giggs has not given up hope of having Ramsey, 28, available at the Cardiff City Stadium, especially as Ethan Ampadu looks set to be left out after lasting only an hour in Trnava. The former Arsenal man is likely to be given until the last possible moment to prove his fitness.

Wales reported no new injury worries after a positive night in Slovakia, with those who played concentrating on rest and recovering yesterday/on Friday.

Kieffer Moore, who scored his first international goal on Thursday, is set to retain his place after having treatment on a head wound, but Liverpool's Harry Wilson, on loan at Bournemouth, could replace Jonny Williams in attacking midfield.

Williams looked tired after being asked both to operate as a No 10 and shackle Slovakia midfielder Stanislav Lobotka.
description: Aaron Ramsey remains a doubt for Wales' Euro 2020 qualifier against Croatia tomorrow/Sunday as he tries to make his first competitive international appearance for more than a year.
